intro: Triosteum intermedium, commonly known as the common triosteum, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Polemoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Triosteum intermedium is often found in wetlands, stream banks, and other moist habitats across the eastern and central United States.
